article.title: Theory of the n=2 levels in muonic helium-3 ions

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is true about the difference of squared helion-to-alpha particle charge radii (r²<sub>h</sub> - r²<sub>α</sub>) as shown in Figure 1?
choices: The discrepancy between measurements from regular, electronic helium atoms and theory calculations is less than 1σ.
The expected uncertainty from laser spectroscopy in muonic helium ions will be similar to the current theoretical uncertainty.
The discrepancy between different measurements in electronic helium is significantly larger than the individual theoretical uncertainties.
Laser spectroscopy of muonic helium ions is expected to be less precise in determining the charge radius difference than electronic helium spectroscopy.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about the energy levels in muonic helium-3 ions, as depicted in Figure 2, is incorrect?
choices: The Lamb shift causes the 2S level to be lower in energy than the 2P levels.
The helion\'s negative magnetic moment leads to a reversed ordering of the hyperfine levels compared to muonic hydrogen.
The fine structure splitting between the 2P<sub>1/2</sub> and 2P<sub>3/2</sub> levels is larger than the 2S hyperfine splitting.
The finite size effect contributes significantly to the hyperfine splitting of the 2S level.
The total Lamb shift in muonic helium-3 ions.
The nuclear structure-independent contributions to the Lamb shift.
The finite size effect on the energy levels in muonic helium-3 ions.
The two-photon exchange contribution to the Lamb shift.
